intro: Asyneuma lobelioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf ironweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late summer to early fall. Asyneuma lobelioides thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, along stream banks, and in swampy areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems and a valuable plant for ecological studies.
